basics.name: Tobias Pfeiffer
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a software engineer, deeply interested in agile methodologies, teaching, the Internet, object oriented programming and developing software systems in a team-oriented approach. I contribute to a variety of open source projects, engage in a multitude of community events and enjoy going to and speaking at conferences.

work.summary: Software engineer and lecturer teaching courses and working on projects.
highlights: Taught 3 introductory level Ruby on Rails courses at the Humboldt-University Berlin
Prepared material for an advanced level Ruby on Rails course
Built a website to show screencasts in a HTML friendly way using HTML5 and popcorn.s

work.summary: Student for the JRuby organization, working on the Shoes 4 code base improving performance, enhancing functionality and refactoring the code to achieve better readability and maintainability.
Working on a spree ecommerce application.
Various jobs at the working group for Internet Technologies at the Hasso Plattner Institute including working as a corrector for the lectures „Internet- and WWW-Technologies“ and „Internet Security“.

volunteer.summary: The Ruby User Group Berlin is a monthly meetup of people interested in Ruby and related topics. Each meeting consists of 3 presentations and a couple of lightning talks. Currently the user group attracts between 80 and 120 attendees per meeting. My main responsibilities are organizing venues, contacting speakers and moderating the meetings as well as the mailing list. Sometimes I also give presentations.

Rails Girls Berlin helps to diversify the tech community. I help by coaching at workshops and hackdays, as well as giving introductory presentations. Moreover I co-host a weekly project group since March 2013 to help interested attendees to dig deeper into the topic.
highlights: Helped multiple attendees to grow into a junior developer position from absolute beginners
Created a well received and often reused introductory slide deck

volunteer.summary: Helped with the team selection process, as well as mentoring two Rails Girls Summer of Code teams.
I've been part of the Shoes community for a long time and since roughly September 2013 assume a maintainer like role for the Shoes 4 project.

Over time I've helped with multiple conferences. This includes student volunteer organizer at XP2012, volunteer at Agile Dev Practices 2013, GOTO Berlin 2013 and jrubyconf.eu 2014, eurucamp 2014. I also spoke at jrubyconf.eu 2013. Most recently I was part of the program committee and a track host for GOTO Berlin 2014.

highlights: Participated in a 9 month, near full time team project develloping a process engine
Participated in 50 person Scrum project to build a Customer Relationship Management system
